result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Anthony Almodobar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerry Anthony Almodobar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerry Anthony Almodobar was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change is filed under the name: Jerry A Trotterchaud. Clerk spoke with DOC and they indicated Mr Almodobar's alias is Jerry Trotterchaud and that is how they have him listed in WICS.
11:46  Defendant Jerry Anthony Almodobar not in court.   Defendant owes Financial Obligations. Court enters judgment in the amount of $443.00.
Defendant's Notice of Hearing. Return to Sender. Not deliverable as addressed.
Probation review hearing on May 30, 2017 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 03:14 16CM53 also heard at this time. Defendant Jerry Anthony Almodobar in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM53 moves to dismiss counts 1,2,4 and moves to dismiss all counts in 16CM39, plead guilty to 16CM53 count 3--S/W 1 year concurrent to supervision currently on.  Nelson agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 3 in 16CM53 misd. bail jumping. Facts correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 3 in 16CM53. Court orders counts 1,2,4 in 16CM53 dismissed and dismisses 16CM39.  Court orders count 3 16CM53: S/W 1 year concurrent with any supervision and probation defendant is currently on. Follow conditions set forth by agent.  Court costs $443.00 DNA Surcharge.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 03:26
